title: Sagrika Chugh
text:
Hey there! Welcome to my corner of computational biology. Join me on this wild ride as I navigate the tangled web of single-cell genomics, armed with nothing but code and a few cups of coffee.
I am a computational biology PhD student in the Bioinformatics and Cellular Genomics Lab at St. Vincent’s Institute of Medical Research and University of Melbourne, in Melbourne, Australia.

My research focuses on single-cell genomics data analysis and development of computational tools for a comprehensive understanding of the genetic basis of complex diseases.
Outside of work, I love to travel on a budget and catch up on my beauty sleep.
